panels.content: Data for $host with $interval resolution

panels.description: Reports whether PMM Server can connect to the PostgreSQL instance.
panels.title: Connected

panels.description: Current Active Connections.

panels.description: Current Active Connections.
panels.title: Active Connections

panels.description: Current Idle Connections.
panels.title: Idle Connections

panels.description: Current Idle in Transaction Connections.
panels.title: Idle in Transactions

panels.description: Queries per second within the interval
panels.title: QPS

panels.description: No. of queries with average time more than 10ms and less than 1s.
panels.title: Queries >10ms and  <1s

panels.description: No. of queries with average time more than 1 seconds and less than 10 seconds.
panels.title: Queries >1s and  <10s

panels.description: No. of queries with average time more than 10 seconds.
panels.title: Queries > 10s

panels.description: Stats have been reset this time ago
panels.title: Last Stats Reset

panels.description: These are the number of blocks not read from shared buffers
panels.title: Cache Hit Ratio

panels.description: Time spent in writing blocks to disk
panels.title: Blocks Write Time

panels.description: Time spent in reading blocks from disk
panels.title: Blocks Read Time

panels.description: Time spent in reading blocks from disk
panels.title: Temp Written

panels.description: Number of Shared Blocks Written in this interval
panels.title: Shared Blocks Written

panels.description: Size of Shared Blocks Read in this interval
panels.title: Shared Blocks Read

panels.description: Transactions per second within the interval
panels.title: TPS

panels.description: Number of Deadlocks and Conflicts
panels.title: Deadlocks & Conflicts

panels.description: Queries cancelled due to Deadlocks or Locks or Tablespace Locks or due to Old snapshot not being available
panels.title: Cancelled Queries

panels.description: Percentage of Index Scans vs Sequence Scans
panels.title: Index Scans Perc

panels.description: Number of locks those protects one or more tables against concurrent data changes.
panels.title: Exclusive Locks

panels.description: These are the locks that are acquired without affecting any of the Read Operations.
panels.title: Other Locks

panels.description: Total number of manual and auto vacuums across the database cluster
panels.title: No. of Vacuum and Autovacuum

panels.description: Total number of manual and automatic analyze  jobs across the database cluster
panels.title: No. of Analyze and Autoanalyze

panels.description: Percentage of dead tuples in the database cluster.
panels.title: Dead Tuples

panels.description: Percentage of Tuples Inserted among Inserts, Updates and Deletes.
panels.title: Tuples Inserted %

panels.description: Percentage of Tuples Deleted among Inserts, Updates and Deletes.
panels.title: Tuples Deleted %

panels.description: Percentage of Tuples Updated among Inserts, Updates and Deletes.
panels.title: Tuples Updated %

panels.content:
The maximum number of concurrent connections ${max_connections} Shared memory buffers (bytes) ${shared_buffers}
The maximum memory to be used for query workspaces (bytes)${work_mem} The number of disk-page buffers in shared memory for WAL (bytes)${wal_buffers}
The number of pages per write ahead log segment (bytes) ${wal_segment_size}The maximum memory to be used for query workspaces (bytes)${maintenance_work_mem}
The block size in the write ahead log ${block_size}The maximum distance in log segments between automatic WAL checkpoints${checkpoint_segments}
Time spent flushing dirty buffers during checkpoint, as fraction of checkpoint interval ${checkpoint_timeout}The maximum number of simultaneously running WAL sender processes${max_wal_senders}
The minimum size to shrink the WAL to (bytes)${min_wal_size}The WAL size that triggers a checkpoint (bytes)${max_wal_size}
Compresses full-page writes written in WAL file ${wal_compression}Maximum number of concurrent worker processes${max_worker_processes}
The maximum number of parallel processes per executor node ${max_parallel_workers_per_gather}The maximum number of parallel processes per executor node${max_parallel_workers}
The default statistics target ${default_statistics_target}The planner's estimate of the cost of a sequentially fetched disk page ${seq_page_cost}
The planner's estimate of the cost of a nonsequentially fetched disk page ${random_page_cost}The planner's assumption about the size of the disk cache${effective_cache_size}
Number of simultaneous requests that can be handled efficiently by the disk subsystem ${effective_io_concurrency}Forces synchronization of updates to disk ${fsync}
Starts the autovacuum subprocess ${autovacuum}Number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze as a fraction of reltuples${autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor}
Minimum number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze ${autovacuum_analyze_threshold}Number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum as a fraction of reltuples${autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor}
Minimum number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum ${autovacuum_vacuum_threshold}Vacuum cost amount available before napping, for autovacuum ${autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit}
Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds, for autovacuum (seconds) ${autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay} The maximum number of simultaneously running autovacuum worker processes ${autovacuum_max_workers}
Time to sleep between autovacuum runs (seconds) ${autovacuum_naptime}Age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent transaction ID wraparound ${autovacuum_freeze_max_age}
The maximum memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process (bytes)${autovacuum_work_mem}Multixact age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent multixact wraparound${autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age}
Start a subprocess to capture stderr output and/or csvlogs into log files ${logging_collector}Sets the minimum execution time above which statements will be logged (seconds) ${log_min_duration_statement}
Logs the duration of each completed SQL statement ${log_duration}Logs long lock waits ${log_lock_waits}
panels.title: PostgreSQL Settings

targets.expr:
clamp_max(((avg by (mode) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu{instance="$host",mode!="idle"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu{instance="$host",mode!="idle"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or (avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{instance=~"$host", mode!="total", mode!="idle"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{instance=~"$host", mode!="total", mode!="idle"}[5m]))),100)
